introPages.title: WELCOME
introPages.content: The SkinSizeâ„¢ diagnostic will help us decode your skin, curate your ideal routine, and prescribe your Klira Special formula.

introPages.title: What is your natural skin colour without tanning or self tanners? Select from the colours below.

questionaireObject.title: SEBUM
questionaireObject.description: Sebum is an oily substance produced by the skin and plays a crucial role in maintaining hydration, protecting against harmful bacteria, and - when produced at an optimum level - keeps the skin's surface balanced and healthy.

questionaire.question: If you don't apply any products at all after washing your face, how does your skin look after a couple of hours?

options.text: Well hydrated with minimal reflection of light
Wet and shiny with a lot of reflection

questionaire.question: Two hours after applying a foundation, but no powder, how does your makeup look?
In a cold and dry environment, without moisturiser you facial skin is...
Look up close in the mirror, how many large pores, bigger than a pin head, do you have?

options.text: A few in the T-zone (forehead and nose) only

questionaire.question: When you use soap that bubbles and foams, how does your facial skin feel?
If you don't moisturise, how often does your facial skin feel tight?
Look at your nose in the mirror do you have blackheads or whiteheads?
In the middle of the day if you wipe your forehead with your fingers does it feel oily?
Two hours after applying moisturiser, how do your cheeks normally look?
Do you ever get red spots on your cheeks, chin or nose?
Which image do they look most like?

questionaireObject.title: BARRIER
questionaireObject.description: The skin barrier is the outermost layer of the skin that acts as a protective shield, preventing moisture loss, blocking harmful bacteria, and defending against environmental damage to maintain overall skin health.

questionaire.question: Do you ever get redness or red patches on your cheeks, chin or nose?
Which image do they look most like?
Do any skincare or makeup products cause your face to itch, sting, break out or get a rash?
Have you ever been diagnosed with rosacea by a dermatologist?

options.text: Friends/family tell me I have it

questionaire.question: Does wearing certain jewellery give you a rash?
Does sunscreen ever make your skin itch, burn, break out or turn red?
Have you ever been diagnosed with eczema, atopic dermatitis or allergic skin disease?

options.text: Friends/family tell me I have it

questionaire.question: Can you use the soap provided in hotels on your body or face without a problem?

options.text: No, my skin itches, turns red or breaks out
I wouldn't use it because of past problems

questionaire.question: Have you or anyone in your family been diagnosed with eczema, asthma, hayfever?

options.text: No, but many of my family members

questionaire.question: How often does your face or neck get red after moderate exercise, stress or a strong emotion like anger?
How often do you tend to go red in the face after drinking alcohol?

options.text: Always, or I don't drink because of this

questionaire.question: How often do you get red and flushed after eating spicy foods or hot drinks?
Look carefully at your nose and cheeks in the mirror - select the image that represents how many visible red or blue broken blood vessels you have.
Do people ever ask you if you are sunburned, even when you aren't?
How often do you get itching, swelling or small bumps from makeup?

questionaireObject.title: MELANIN
questionaireObject.description: Melanin is a natural pigment produced by melanocytes that provides skin with its colour and protects against UV radiation.

questionaire.question: After you have a spot or ingrown hair, how often is it followed by a dark brown or black mark?
After you cut yourself, how long does the brown (not pink) mark remain?

options.text: I don't get a brown mark

questionaire.question: Did you develop patches of brown marks on the skin (usually on the top of the lip, forehead or sides of the cheeks) when pregnant or taking birth control after exposure to the sun?

options.text: I don't get a brown mark

questionaire.question: Do you currently have any flat dark patches on your upper lips, side of the lower jaw or your upper cheeks?
Do the dark marks on your face become more obvious after sun exposure?
Do you have, or have you ever had, small brown spots on your face?

options.text: Yes, a few (1-5) on my face

questionaire.question: When exposed to sun for the first time in several months, how does your skin react?

options.text: It is hard to see as I already have dark skin

questionaire.question: What happens after you've had a few consecutive days of sun exposure?

options.text: I sunburn and blister, but my skin does not change colour
It is hard to see as I already have dark skin

questionaire.question: When you go in the sun do you develop freckles?

options.text: A few small freckles each year
It's hard to see as my skin is dark

questionaire.question: What is your natural hair colour?
questionaire.hint: If you're grey then choose the colour before greying.

questionaire.question: Do you or anyone in your family have a history of malignant melanoma?

options.text: More than one person in my family
I have a history of melanoma

questionaireObject.title: COLLAGEN
questionaireObject.description: Collagen is a protein that provides structure, elasticity, and firmness to the skin, helping maintain its strength and smooth appearance.

questionaire.question: Select the image which best represents your skin.
questionaire.hint: i. If you've had injectable cosmetic treatments, select the answer you think represents your natural skin.

questionaire.question: How old does or did your mother's facial skin look?
How old does or did your father's facial skin look?
At any time in your life have you ever tanned your skin on an ongoing basis for more than 2 weeks per year? If so, for how many years did you do this?
questionaire.hint: i. Think about tanning from playing sports, travelling, outdoor work or activities.

questionaire.question: At any time in your life, have you ever engaged in seasonal tanning of 2 weeks per year or less? If so, how often?
Based on the places you have lived, how much daily sun exposure have you received in your life?

options.text: Little; I've mostly lived in places that are grey and overcast
Some; I've lived in less sunny climes at times, but also places with regular sun
Moderate; I've lived in places with a fair amount of sun exposure
A lot; I've lived in tropical, southern, or very sunny places

questionaire.question: How old do you think you look?

options.text: More than 5 years older than my age

questionaire.question: During the last five years, how often have you allowed your skin to tan either intentionally or unintentionally, including through outdoor activities or sports?
How often, if ever, have you used a tanning bed?
Over your entire life, how many cigarettes have you smoked?

options.text: I've never smoked, but have been surrounded by people who regularly smoked in my presence

questionaire.question: Describe the air pollution where you live...

options.text: Sometimes I live where the air is fresh and clean

questionaire.question: Have you ever used a prescription-grade retinoid?

options.text: Once for acne when I was younger

questionaire.question: How often do you eat fruit and vegetables?
Over your lifetime what percentage of your daily diet has consisted of fresh fruit and vegetables?
What is your age group?
